title: blackletter 'y's
content:
I’m using Fraktur as the font on the cover of a book I’m designing. It works fine apart from the letter ’y’ which the publisher argues is illegible in it’s current form. Any suggestions for an alternative black letter font?

 [‹ Spraying Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122075110/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48301 "Go to previous forum topic") [Need Help with ID ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122075110/http:/www.typophile.com/node/21489 "Go to next forum topic")
author: crazig

comments.content:
Fraktur? You mean [Fette Fraktur](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122075110/http:/www.identifont.com/show?LH)?  
Some fine other blackletter-fonts you’ll find [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122075110/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=fraktur) or [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122075110/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=blackletter). Or try [Blaktur](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122075110/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=581&subpage=viewfonts) by House.

Two other blackletters made for the modern reader: [Litteratra](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122075110/http:/kltf.de/kltf_litteratra.htm) and [Fakir](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122075110/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php?id1=fakir&id2=overview).
